remarks: Property of an epimorphism.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)
statement:
isepi.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
isepi.h $e |- H = ( Hom ` C ) $.
isepi.o $e |- .x. = ( comp ` C ) $.
isepi.e $e |- E = ( Epi ` C ) $.
isepi.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
isepi.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
isepi.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
epii.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. B ) $.
epii.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( X E Y ) ) $.
epii.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. ( Y H Z ) ) $.
epii.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. ( Y H Z ) ) $.
epii $p |- ( ph -> ( ( G ( <. X , Y >. .x. Z ) F ) = ( K ( <. X , Y >. .x. Z ) F ) <-> G = K ) ) $.
